name: Headley Heath Military Trail, Box Hill

ai.summary: An 8.1 km moderate hike along the Headley Heath Military Trail, looping through open heathland and woodland around Box Hill in the Surrey Hills. The route combines long, exposed stretches with shaded sections, offering expansive views and a touch of wartime history along well-marked paths suitable for hikers with some experience.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly heathland on chalk with some gentle climbs. Surfaces are a mix of compact gravel, dirt tracks, and grassy paths; expect uneven sections near viewpoints and short, steeper segments in exposed places. Trails are well-marked, with occasional sections through pine woodland.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather and wind exposure on exposed heathlands. Wear sturdy footwear and bring layers, plus a waterproof jacket. Carry enough water (about 2 L) and snacks. Stay on marked trails, watch for cyclists and other hikers, and be mindful of livestock near farms. Bring a map or offline GPS, a charged phone, and a small first-aid kit. Dogs should be under control, and be cautious of busy parking areas near Box Hill.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October; conditions are often best in late spring and early summer).
